sentences.en: "Frankly I found it rather frightening." — "A little startling," Mark agreed.
sentences.cn: “坦白说我觉得这相当可怕。”——“是有点吓人，”马克表示同意。

sentences.en: Eton College was founded by Henry VI in 1440.
sentences.cn: 伊顿公学于1440年由亨利六世创办。

sentences.en: Founded in 1935 in Ohio, Alcoholics Anonymous is now a world-wide organization.
sentences.cn: 嗜酒者互诫协会1935年创立于俄亥俄州，现在是一个世界性的组织。

sentences.en: Four men were found guilty of breach of the peace.
sentences.cn: 四名男子被判扰乱治安罪名成立。

sentences.en: He found evidence of mutated forms of the gene.
sentences.cn: 他找到了该基因出现了变异形式的证据。

sentences.en: He was found desperately trying to untangle several reels of film.
sentences.cn: 他被撞见拼命想要解开几盘缠在一起的胶卷。

sentences.en: However, many customers found the smell of this product distinctly off-putting.
sentences.cn: 然而，很多顾客觉得该产品有一股异味，非常难闻。

sentences.en: I found her a rather austere, distant, somewhat cold person.
sentences.cn: 我发现她相当严厉，拒人于千里之外，近乎冷漠。

sentences.en: I found myself smiling back instinc-tively when our eyes met.
sentences.cn: 我发现当我们的目光相遇时，我本能地还以微笑。

sentences.en: I found the characters very two-dimensional, not to say dull.
sentences.cn: 我觉得那些人物形象即使不说是乏味无聊，至少也是毫无深度。

sentences.en: Neat solutions are not easily found to these issues.
sentences.cn: 很难找到解决这些问题的巧妙办法。

sentences.en: The girl had found out about the goings-on in the factory.
sentences.cn: 这个女孩已经发现了工厂里的勾当。

sentences.en: The jury found that the NFL had violated antitrust laws.
sentences.cn: 陪审团裁决全国橄榄球联盟触犯了反垄断法。

sentences.en: The police inferred that they found her behaviour rather suspicious.
sentences.cn: 警方暗示他们发现她行为非常可疑。

sentences.en: They checked in their luggage and found seats in the departure lounge.
sentences.cn: 他们办完行李托运，到候机室找了座位坐下。

sentences.en: They found a labyrinth of tunnels under the ground.
sentences.cn: 他们发现了一处迷宫似的地道。

sentences.en: We found him very approachable and easy to talk with.
sentences.cn: 我们认为他非常和蔼可亲，容易交谈。

words.tran_cn: 基础；地基；基金会；根据；创立

trans.tran_en: to start something such as an organization, company, school, or city, often by providing the necessary money
to start something such as an organization, company, school, or city, often by providing the necessary money
